dataIdInfo.idPurp: The purpose of this dataset is to provide the Massachuesetts Office of Geographic Information with a polygon representation of the parcels for the Town of Boxborough, Massachuesetts that comply with its Level III standards.
dataIdInfo.idAbs: This dataset is a polygon representation of the parcels for the Town of Boxborough, Massachusetts. Edits to a base parcel file were made to the spatial and tabular data in order to bring the file in compliance with November 2010 MassGIS Level III Standards for Digital Parcel Files. These edits included ensuring that the parcel fabric was continuous and closed with no gaps or overlaps. Additionally, parcels were snapped to the legislatively approved MassGIS TOWNSSURVEY_ARC town boundary datalayer and compared against the 2008 30 cm MassGIS Ortho Imagery. Polygons were assigned a LOC_ID that links to the M131Assessor table and other fields were populated where they were known and applicable. Annual parcel updates completed January 2024. Geometry and attribute data updated on 01/2024.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Parcel mapping data maintained by CAI Technologies

idCitation.resTitle: Parcel data for Boxborough, MA complying with Level 3 of MassGIS digital parcel standard

Consts.useLimit: This data may be appropriate for planning purposes. It should not be utilized where legal and surveyed property boundaries are required.

descript.abstract: Assessor's parcel data for city of Boxborough, MA. Developed from existing digital data. Geometry and attribute data updated on March 2018

idinfo.accconst: This digital parcel data layer is considered to be in the public domain and will become accessible for download and display from the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/mgis
idinfo.useconst: This data may be appropriate for planning purposes. It should not be utilized where legal and surveyed property boundaries are required.
idinfo.native: This parcel data is submitted to MassGIS in a file geodatabase. It will be incorporated into the MassGIS SDE database, and may be converted into other GIS data types for future distribution.
idinfo.datacred: Applied Geographics, Boston, MA; Town of Boxborough Planning Department and Assessor's Department, Boxborough, MA.

citeinfo.title: Data for town of Boxborough, MA, complying with Level 3 of MassGIS digital parcel standard
citeinfo.origin: Planning Department, Town of Boxborough, MA

dataqual.logic: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public right of ways exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer.

attracc.attraccr:
Total number of parcels = 1748 Required match rate where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 99.8 pct Required match rate where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL <= $1000: 97.0 pct
Total number of records in assessor table = 2549 Total records where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 2164 Of these, total records with valid LOC_ID that join to tax parcels: 2164 Match rate for parcels where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 100.00 pct High value match rate passes QA.
Total records where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL < $1000: 385 Of these, total records with valid LOC_ID join to tax parcels: 385 Match rate for parcels where BLDG_VAL and OTHER_VAL <= $1000: 100.00 pct Low value match rate passes QA.
Required match rate for 1748 parcels: 99.0 pct Total number of parcels with "TAX" or "FEE" POLY_TYPE and NO_MATCH = "N": 1730 Of these, 1727 join to assessor list. Match rate for "FEE"/"TAX" parcels to assessor table: 99.83 pct Parcel to assessor match rate is ok. Passes QA.

horizpa.horizpar: Data compiled or reviewed for horizontal accuracy over the MassGIS color orthos from 2008/2009; these orthos are known to be +/- 10' horizontal; however, this data set cannot be used to reach authoritative conclusions about the horizontal accuracy of the boundaries depicted. That work requires a licensed land surveyor.

srcinfo.srccontr: Town of Boxborough 12 tax maps at 1"-400' automated in 2007

procstep.procdesc: Existing GIS parcel data was converted to MassGIS Level 3 template geodatabase and additional data layers and tables were added.
Spatial accuracy of data was verified using the parcel standard guidelines; town boundary was verified to be coincident with MassGIS town Boundary layer. Polygon topology was updated and validated.

Multipart polygons were created where necessary; internal polygon boundaries were dissolved where necessary; polygons representing legal boundaries such as easements or private right-of-ways were created. LOC_ID was generated or updated.

Updates were made to the Level II data to reflect the most current version of the town's tax maps as of May 2011 for the town's FY 2012. CAMA data was matched against parcel data to produce a mismatch report which was reconciled with the help of the town. Final QA/QC tool was run.

Overlay errors between TaxPar and OthLeg were corrected. Multilink errors between TaxPar and Assess were verified or corrected. Lotsize discrepancies between shape area in TaxPar and LOTSIZE in Assess were verified or corrected.

Updates were made to the Level III data to reflect the most current version of the town's tax maps as of January 2018 for the town's FY 2018. CAMA data was matched against parcel data to produce a mismatch report which was reconciled with the help of the town. Final QA/QC tool was run.

overview.dsoverv: Parcel data for the town of Boxborough, MA. Data represents boundaries of approximately 1700 properties, and corresponding information from the town's records of property assessment, including property address, use code and value. Property boundaries are current as of November 2012; property record information is current as of October 2012, and represent data for the the town's fiscal year 2013.
overview.eaover:
For a full description of the features and attributes contained in this data, please refer to the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files - v2.0.
http://www.mass.gov/mgis/standards.htm#Parstandard

distinfo.distliab: This parcel data is in the public domain and should not be redistributed for a fee beyond reproduction costs.

onlinopt.accinstr: Click on the "Download this layer" link to access all digital parcels.

distinfo.custom: Upon compliance with level 3 of the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files, this data will be made available for download on the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/mgis/parcels.htm
distinfo.resdesc: M037TaxPar represents a version of digital municipal parcels for the community of Ayer, MA that is considered ‘level 3’ compliant per the specifications outlined in the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files. Its features can be linked in a GIS or database environment to a set of standardized assessing attributes in the table M037Assess by using the unique identifying values in the LOC_ID field. This data is also intended to be used in conjunction with associated (and optional) features in the ancillary data layers M037OthLeg and M037Misc. As one of the data sets identified by Massachusetts’ Strategic Plan for Spatial Data Infrastructure (http://www.mass.gov/mgis/stratplan.html), this data enters the public domain as a valuable resource for mapping, planning, and analysis at all levels of government as well as the private sector.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
